definition: to repay/to compensate for/to recompense/to fulfill (hopes etc)
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: We cannot let humans pay for our mistakes .
sentences.chinese: 我们不能让人的总称为我们的错误而偿命。

sentences.english: Return to money if you borrow it, you must dead if you kill someone.
sentences.chinese: 借钱还钱，杀人偿命这是天经地意的事。

sentences.english: Life for life, he will be sentence to death.
sentences.chinese: 以命偿命，他将被判处死刑。
他想让贝拉特里克斯为此偿命。

sentences.english: The forest family member reprimands the police again and again, the request "pays with a life by the life".
sentences.chinese: 林的家人一遍又一遍地申斥警方，要求“以命偿命”。

definition: death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
A debt of blood must be paid in blood./Blood calls for blood.
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to kill/to cause death/to do sb to death
to make mincemeat of sb/to hack sb to pieces (used while cursing)
guilty and deserves to be punished (idiom); entirely appropriate chastisement/the punishment fits the crime
to hack to death/to kill with an ax
